wikipedia_page.main:
Ronald Forfar (6 January 1939 – 28 September 2020) was a British actor who appeared in many roles since the 1970s, including the role of Freddie Boswell in Carla Lane's comedy Bread.
Forfar was born in 1939 in Liverpool, Merseyside, England, UK. He was educated at Liverpool Collegiate. He played a tragedian in Rosencrantz and Guildenstern Are Dead in 1966. Other parts include a tax inspector, Costello The Second, in Alan Bleasdale's The Muscle Market (a Boys from the Blackstuff prequel) and The Soothsayer in Herbert Wise's BBC television adaption of Julius Caesar. Shakespearian roles include Bates in Henry V and First Officer in Laurence Olivier's version of King Lear.
He also appeared in The Sweeney, Tutti Frutti, Chucklevision (as 'Professor Frimley'), The New Avengers and Graham Chapman's film Yellowbeard. He had four brothers, two of whom pre-deceased him.
In 2018 Ronald worked on what would be his last project, a short film called The All-Nighter, written and directed by Lee Phillips, and co-starring Erkan Mustafa and Martin Hancock. 
Forfar died on 28 September 2020, aged 81.

response: The Boswell family consisted of Nellie's philandering, free-spirited husband Freddie (Ronald Forfar) who spent most of the series with one foot in the family household, and the other with his mistress, the red-haired Irish siren Lilo Lil (Eileen Pollock). This union led to one of the series' most famous catchphrases, which Nellie frequently declared about Lilo Lil in a storm of rage: "She is a tart!"
| Ronald Forfar || Freddie Boswell || 62 || 1–1990 Christmas Special || 1986–1990
He acted in The All-Nighter, a 10 minute short film released in 2018, along with Ronald Forfar and Martin Hancock.
